instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu vcore
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came in with no liquid damage. Turns on but no internal or external video. CPU vcore is stuck at 1.1V Already tried good ram, one in each slot. New bios with new ME region and replaced SMC.

SPI resistors measure as they should.

What to check for next??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> cpu vcore
threads.message:
Be sure to get 25MHz at pin 9 of <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>.
Also check if <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL> are both high.
If all OK, then is probably bad CPU, less probably PCH issue.

As nothing to lose, put quality flux and reflow CPU and PCH in the end...
